recipes.title: Rhubarb Preserves
recipes.attribution: Grandpa Ed
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card - Grandpa Ed's favorite, marked with a smiley face
recipes.description: Simple rhubarb preserves with orange slices - Grandpa Ed's favorite recipe.

instructions.text: Combine rhubarb, sugar, cut up orange slices, and water in a large pot.
Boil until all dissolved.
Stir constantly.

notes: Grandpa Ed's favorite - the original card has a smiley face drawn next to his name
Stir constantly to prevent scorching

recipes.title: Old Sour
recipes.attribution: Steve Raichlen
recipes.source_note: Miami Spice by Steve Raichlen, Workman Publishing
recipes.description: The granddad of Floridian sauces - a Key West lime and chile condiment that improves with age.

ingredients.item: scotch bonnet chiles, bird peppers, datil peppers, or other hot chiles
ingredients.prep_note: whole for milder, sliced for hotter

ingredients.item: fresh Key lime juice or regular lime juice

instructions.text: Leave chiles whole for milder sauce; thinly slice for hotter sauce.
Combine all ingredients in a sterile jar and cover tightly.
Shake well to dissolve the salt.
Let stand for 1 week at room temperature before using.
Stir or shake before seasoning meat or seafood.

notes: A staple in the Key West pantry
Will keep without refrigeration for months and gets better with age
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 132.jpeg

recipes.title: Carrot-Lemon Marmalade
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Olga Echart, San Antonio, Texas
recipes.source_note: Newspaper/magazine clipping (partial - left side cut off)
recipes.description: Prize-winning marmalade with carrots, lemon, and maraschino cherries for texture and color.

ingredients.prep_note: chopped (use fine blade of food grinder or chop very finely)

instructions.text: Use fine blade of food grinder or chop very finely.
Combine chopped carrot, chopped lemon, sugar, [UNCLEAR] and water.
[UNCLEAR] boil. Cook over medium high heat for 10 [UNCLEAR].
Cook an additional 3 to 5 minutes or till thick- [UNCLEAR] metal spoon.
Pour into clean, hot jelly glasses; [UNCLEAR].

notes: LEFT SIDE OF RECIPE CUT OFF - some quantities unclear
Maraschino cherries add texture to this prize-winning marmalade
From Mrs. Olga Echart, San Antonio, Texas

flags.issue: Left side of recipe cut off - quantities unclear

recipes.title: Cholesterol-Free Mayonnaise
recipes.description: Homemade mayonnaise using egg substitute and polyunsaturated oil - no cholesterol.

instructions.text: In a blender, combine egg substitute, vinegar, sugar, dry mustard, salt, celery salt, paprika, cayenne and 1/4 cup of oil.
Cover; blend at medium until mixed, about 5 seconds.
Continue blending; add remaining oil in a fine stream through the small top opening until mixture is thick.
Scrape sides as necessary.

notes: Cholesterol-free alternative to regular mayonnaise
Use polyunsaturated oil for heart health

recipes.title: Hot Dan's Dressing
recipes.description: Versatile mustard-based dressing for coleslaw, potato salad, or deviled eggs.

ingredients.item: half and half or undiluted evaporated milk

instructions.text: Combine mustard, sugar, vinegar, half and half and salt in a small bowl; beat with rotary beater until light and fluffy.

notes: Good for cole slaw, potato salad or deviled eggs
For Deviled Eggs: Use 3 tablespoons of the dressing for mixing with the mashed yolks of 6 hard-cooked eggs
For Potato Salad: Use all the dressing to mix with 6 cups sliced, cooked potatoes, 1/2 cup chopped celery and 1/4 cup chopped green onions

recipes.title: Jalapeño Peppers
recipes.description: Home-canned pickled jalapeño peppers with a tangy olive oil brine.

instructions.text: Wash peppers.
Pack tightly in sterilized jar.
Heat to boiling: vinegar, water, olive oil, salt and pickling spices.
Pour over peppers to within 1 inch of jar top.
Put on cap, screw band firmly tight.
Process 10 minutes in boiling water bath (start timer soon as water returns to boil).

notes: Follow safe canning practices
Wear gloves when handling hot peppers

recipes.title: Bread and Butter Jalapeños
recipes.description: Sweet and tangy pickled jalapeño rounds - a spicy twist on bread and butter pickles.

instructions.text: Wash and stem jalapeños. Cut in circle rounds including seeds.
Put all ingredients in large pot. Boil for 20 minutes or until tender.
Place in canning jars, seal and put in hot water bath for 10 minutes.

notes: Wear gloves when handling jalapeños
Seeds included for extra heat

recipes.title: Green Tomato Mince Meat
recipes.description: Traditional mincemeat filling made with green tomatoes and beef suet, perfect for pies.

instructions.text: Place green tomatoes in a large pot with 2 quarts water and 1 tablespoon salt. Boil until tender.
Drain tomatoes and set pot on back of stove (low heat).
Add vinegar, 1 quart water, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, pepper, raisins, brown sugar, and chopped beef suet.
Boil slowly on back of stove for 4-5 hours, stirring occasionally, until thick and well blended.
Use for pies or can for later use.

notes: This is a traditional mincemeat recipe using green tomatoes instead of apples
Can be canned for preservation

recipes.title: Sweet Cucumber Pickles
recipes.description: Classic bread-and-butter style sweet pickles with mustard and celery seed.

instructions.text: Slice cucumbers and onions. Layer with salt and let stand several hours or overnight. Drain well.
Combine vinegar, sugar, mustard seed, celery seed, and turmeric in a large pot.
Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve sugar.
Add drained cucumbers and onions. Heat through but do not boil.
Pack into hot sterilized jars and seal, or refrigerate.

notes: Similar to bread-and-butter pickles
Can be canned for shelf storage

recipes.title: Zucchini Pickles
recipes.description: Bread-and-butter style pickles made with zucchini instead of cucumbers.

instructions.text: Combine first six ingredients (vinegar through mustard) in saucepan and bring to boil.
Pour over zucchinis and onions and let stand 1 hour. Stir occasionally.
In big kettle, bring mixture to boil, then simmer 3 minutes.
Continue simmering while quickly packing one clean, hot preserving jar at a time.
Fill to within 1/2 inch of top, making sure vinegar solution covers vegetables.
Cap each jar and process 5 minutes in boiling hot water bath.

notes: Great way to use garden zucchini
Process in water bath for shelf storage

recipes.title: Jelly Remake Instructions
recipes.description: Instructions for remaking jelly that didn't set properly, using Sure Jell Light pectin.

instructions.text: Prepare Pectin Mixture: Slowly stir 1 box Sure Jell Light into 1 1/2 cups cold water.
Bring to a boil at once over medium heat.
Boil 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.
For each trial batch: Measure 1 cup soft jam or jelly.
Add appropriate amount of pectin mixture and re-process as directed on pectin package.

notes: Used to rescue jelly that didn't set
Follow Sure Jell Light package directions for ratios

flags: Recipe incomplete - trial batch instructions cut off

recipes.title: Pickled Dills (Sweet)
recipes.description: Sweet pickled dills made by pouring a hot sugar-vinegar syrup over drained dill pickles.

instructions.text: Drain the pickles.
Combine vinegar, mixed pickling spice, and sugar in a saucepan.
Boil for 8 minutes.
Pour hot syrup over drained pickles.
Allow to cool, then refrigerate.

notes: This transforms regular dill pickles into sweet pickles

flags: Mixed spice amount slightly unclear in original

recipes.title: Pickled (Dilly) Beans
recipes.description: Crisp pickled green beans with dill and garlic in a simple vinegar brine.

instructions.text: Snip ends from beans.
Par boil beans for 10 minutes - no salt in water.
Cool immediately with ice cubes and cold water.
In each jar, place 1/2 clove garlic and 2 tbsp chopped dill (or 1 sprig).
Pack beans into jars.
Heat to boiling: 2 cups water, 2 cups white vinegar, 4 tsp sugar, and 4 tbsp salt.
Pour hot brine over beans in jars and seal.

notes: Ice bath stops cooking and keeps beans crisp

recipes.title: Apricot Preserves
recipes.description: Simple homemade apricot preserves with just fruit, water, and sugar.

instructions.text: Wash and pit apricots.
Place apricots in water and simmer until soft, about 10 minutes.
Remove apricots with slotted spoon and puree until smooth.
Stir sugar into apricot puree.
Cook slowly over low heat until mixture is thick, about 40 minutes, stirring frequently.
Spoon into hot sterilized jars and seal.

notes: Use fully ripe apricots for best flavor
Stir frequently to prevent scorching

recipes.title: Bob Meaker's Mustard Sauce
recipes.attribution: Bob Meaker / Storm
recipes.description: Unique mustard sauce thinned with beer and aged for 3 days.

instructions.text: Leave salad dressing in jar.
Add Colman's mustard, salt, sugar, and cayenne pepper to jar.
Mix with mixer or whisk until well combined.
Thin to consistency of thick cream with beer.
Recap jar and age 3 days before using.

notes: Beer adds unique flavor and helps thin the sauce
Must age 3 days for best flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 896.jpeg

recipes.title: Jalapeno Pepper Jelly
recipes.description: Sweet and spicy pepper jelly, perfect for appetizers with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Cut up peppers and put with vinegar in blender or food processor to grind.
Combine pepper mixture with sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
Boil 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand 1 minute.
Add pectin and food coloring if desired.
Pour into hot, sterilized jars to within 1/8-inch of top.
Wipe top and threads with clean, damp cloth. Put hot lid on with sealing compound next to jar.
Screw band on evenly and tightly. Invert jar for a few seconds so hot jelly can destroy any mold or yeast on lid.
Cool, test for seal, remove bands and store.

notes: Wear gloves when handling hot peppers
Great served over cream cheese with crackers
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 898.jpeg

recipes.title: Rhubarb Conserve
recipes.attribution: Martin Bruer
recipes.description: Sweet conserve combining rhubarb, dried peaches, and crushed pineapple.

instructions.text: Chop dried peaches into little chunks with a sharp knife or kitchen scissors.
Soak peaches overnight in 1 cup of water.
Next morning, sterilize 4 pint jars.
Combine soaked peaches (with liquid), rhubarb, pineapple, and sugar in a large pot.
Cook until conserve looks thick, clear and shiny. A good test for thickness is when a portion spooned onto a cool plate sets quickly.
Pour into the 4 sterilized pint jars and cover surface with melted paraffin.

notes: Heavenly with hot toast or biscuits
Also delicious as a sauce over ice cream
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 899.jpeg

recipes.title: Italian Seasoning Mix
recipes.description: Homemade Italian seasoning blend for dressings and marinades.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Store in airtight container.
Use to season dressings, marinades, or sprinkle on dishes.

notes: Card was photographed upside down
Some ingredients unclear due to handwriting

recipes.title: Mission Inn Honey Mustard Dressing
recipes.attribution: Mission Inn
recipes.description: Restaurant-style honey mustard dressing with poppy seeds.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.
Refrigerate until ready to use.

notes: Restaurant recipe
Adjust Worcestershire and Tabasco to taste

recipes.title: Honey Mustard Dressing (Mickie Craig)
recipes.attribution: Mickie Craig of Dunnellon
recipes.description: Creamy homemade honey mustard dressing, stores for up to 7 days.

instructions.text: Put all ingredients in a blender.
Process until combined and smooth.
Store in a glass jar in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.

notes: Use vegetable oil, not olive oil
Stores up to 7 days refrigerated

recipes.title: Sweet Society Chips (Min's)
recipes.attribution: Min
recipes.description: Sweet pickle chips made over 9 days with a sweet vinegar syrup.

ingredients.prep_note: unwashed, may use a few more

instructions.text: Days 1-4: Leave pickles whole. Heat fresh water to boiling each day and pour over pickles. Use fresh water each day. Do not cover and use no salt.
Day 5: Slice pickles 1/4 inch thick.
Make syrup: Combine vinegar, sugar, pickling spices, and salt. Bring to boiling point.
Add green food coloring if desired and pour syrup over sliced pickles.
Days 6, 7, 8: Drain syrup, bring to boil, and pour back over pickles.
Day 9: Drain syrup and bring to boil. Pack pickles in jars, pour hot syrup over, and seal.

notes: 9-day process
Original recipe says to drop chips in hot syrup before packing
Use unwashed cucumbers
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 507.jpeg

recipes.title: Norma Lee's Marinade
recipes.attribution: Norma Lee
recipes.description: Asian-inspired marinade for grilled meats with soy, ginger, and wine.

ingredients.prep_note: or ½ cup vinegar + splash of wine
or 1 medium fresh onion, chopped fine

instructions.text: Mix together the ginger, sugar, dry mustard, pepper, and onion to form a paste.
In a separate bowl, combine soy sauce, wine vinegar, and water.
Blend the paste into the liquid mixture.
Pour marinade over meat and leave at room temperature awhile, spooning marinade over meat occasionally.
Refrigerate until ready to cook.
Remove meat from refrigerator at least 2-3 hours before cooking on grill.
Place on hot grill. Brown both sides fast to seal in juices.
Continue cooking, adding some marinade to keep meat moist and flavored.
Cut roast on an angle to serve.

notes: Grandma's note: 'I like wet pepper'
May save unused marinade and use on hamburgers or chicken within 2-3 days

recipes.title: Spicey Mustard
recipes.description: Homemade honey-molasses mustard with brandy and wine.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix well until thoroughly combined.
Store in jars in the refrigerator.

notes: Makes a large batch - good for gift-giving
The brandy, wine, and vermouth add complexity

recipes.title: Fish Marinade for Smoking
recipes.description: Brine marinade for smoking fish, similar to the earlier smoked fish recipe.

instructions.text: Mix water, salt, brown sugar, vinegar, and garlic powder.
Place fish in brine and soak for 72 hours.
Stir/mix the brine 3 times during soaking.
Before smoking, season both sides with seasoned salt.
Smoke fish until done.

notes: Larger batch than the other smoked fish recipe
3-day brining for best results
recipes.variant_notes: Larger batch with slightly different proportions

recipes.title: Virginia's Pickled Veggies
recipes.attribution: Virginia/Beulah
recipes.description: Quick pickling brine for mixed vegetables - cucumbers, beans, squash, carrots.

instructions.text: Combine sugar, white vinegar, water, salt and dill in a pot.
Boil for 1 minute.
Pour over veggies - unpeeled cucumbers, beans, sliced squash, carrots, etc.
Add clove of garlic to each jar.

notes: Amount of sugar can be reduced to 1½ cups

recipes.title: Pickled Beans (Dilly Beans)
recipes.description: Classic dilly beans for canning - crisp pickled green beans with garlic and dill.

ingredients.prep_note: chopped, or sprig fresh dill per jar

instructions.text: Snip beans and parboil unsalted for 10 minutes. Cool in ice water.
Place clove garlic in each jar. Add 2 tbsp chopped dill, or sprig of fresh dill.
Heat 2 cups water, 2 cups white vinegar, 4 tsp sugar, and 4 tbsp salt.
Bring to boil and pour over beans in jar to full. Seal.

notes: Parboiling and ice bath keeps beans crisp
For proper canning, follow current USDA guidelines

recipes.title: Lois' Ice Box Pickles
recipes.attribution: Lois
recipes.description: Refrigerator pickles with turmeric and pickling spices - no canning required.

instructions.text: Heat sugar and vinegar to dissolve the sugar.
Add salt, turmeric, celery seed, and mustard seed.
Pour over prepared cucumbers in jars.
Refrigerate - no canning needed.

notes: Ice box pickles store in refrigerator, not shelf-stable

recipes.title: Bread & Butter Pickles
recipes.description: Classic sweet bread and butter pickles with pickling spices.

instructions.text: Slice cucumbers and onions, layer with salt, let sit, then drain.
Heat vinegar and sugar with mustard seed, celery seed, and turmeric.
Add drained cucumbers and onions.
Pack into jars and process according to canning guidelines.

notes: Classic sweet pickle recipe
Follow USDA canning guidelines for safe processing

recipes.title: Pickled Beans (Variant)
recipes.description: Another version of dilly beans for canning.

instructions.text: Snip beans and parboil for 10 minutes.
Cool in ice water.
Put ½ clove garlic in each jar.
Add 2 tbsp chopped dill or sprig to each jar.
Heat water, vinegar, sugar, and salt - bring to boil.
Pour over beans and seal.

recipes.title: Pickled Veggies (Variant)
recipes.description: Simple pickling brine for vegetables.

instructions.text: Combine sugar, water, vinegar, and salt.
Boil for 1 minute.
Pour over prepared vegetables.

notes: Sugar amount can be adjusted to taste

recipes.title: Nut-Flavored Oil
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Homemade nut-infused oil to add zest to salads and dressings.

ingredients.item: unblanched shelled whole hazelnuts, almonds, or walnuts

instructions.text: To make flavored oil, place 1 1/2 cups unblanched shelled whole hazelnuts, almonds, or walnuts in a blender container or food processor. Cover; blend or process till chopped. With blender on slow speed, gradually add 1/2 cup salad oil through opening in lid. Blend till the nuts are finely chopped.

Transfer mixture to a small saucepan. Place a candy thermometer in the pan. Cook over low heat, stirring often, till thermometer registers 160°. Remove from heat; cool slightly. Combine mixture with 2 cups salad oil. Cover tightly; let stand in a cool place for 1 to 2 weeks.

Line a colander with several layers of cheesecloth. Pour mixture through colander; let drain in a bowl. Discard nut paste. Pour strained oil into a clean 1-pint jar; cover tightly. Store in the refrigerator up to 3 months. Makes 2 1/2 cups (forty 1-tablespoon servings).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Mayonnaise
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Homemade mayonnaise - creamy and fresh.

instructions.text: In a small mixer bowl combine mustard, salt, paprika, if desired, and red pepper. Add egg yolks and vinegar or lemon juice. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed till combined.
With mixer running, add the oil, 1 teaspoon at a time, till 2 tablespoons oil have been added. Add the remaining oil in a thin, steady stream. (This should take about 5 minutes.)
Cover and store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Makes about 2 cups (thirty-two 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Variations: Blender Mayonnaise, Herb Blender Mayonnaise, Citrus Blender Mayonnaise

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Green Goddess Dressing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy herb dressing with anchovy - transforms into a refreshing vegetable dip without the milk.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine parsley, mayonnaise, sour cream, onion, vinegar, anchovy paste, basil, garlic powder, and tarragon. Cover and blend or process till smooth.
Cover and store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Before serving, stir in milk to make of desired consistency. Makes about 1 cup (sixteen 1-tablespoon servings).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Thousand Island Dressing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic creamy dressing with chili sauce and eggs.

instructions.text: Combine mayonnaise and chili sauce. Stir in egg, olives, sweet pepper, onion, and, if desired, Worcestershire sauce.
Cover; store in the refrigerator up to 1 week. If necessary, stir in milk to make of desired consistency. Makes 1 1/4 cups (twenty-four 1-tablespoon servings).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Vinaigrette
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Basic oil and vinegar dressing with herbs.

ingredients.item: snipped fresh thyme, oregano, or basil; or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, oregano, or basil, crushed
dry mustard or 1 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard

instructions.text: In a screw-top jar mix oil, vinegar, sugar, herb, paprika, mustard, if desired, and pepper. Cover; shake well.
Store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Shake before serving. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Variations: French, Italian, Red Wine, Garlic, Onion, Ginger, Citrus and Poppy Seed Vinaigrette

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Blue Cheese Dressing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy dressing with crumbled blue cheese.

ingredients.item: plain yogurt or dairy sour cream

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine yogurt or sour cream, cottage cheese, mayonnaise, and 1/4 cup of the blue cheese. Cover and blend or process till smooth.
Stir in remaining blue cheese. If necessary, stir in milk to make of desired consistency. Cover and store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Makes 1 1/2 cups (twenty 1-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Cranberry-Orange Relish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh relish that can be stored in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks or frozen up to 6 months.

instructions.text: Finely shred 1 tablespoon orange peel. Peel and section oranges. Using a food processor or food grinder with a coarse blade, process or grind orange sections and cranberries. (If using a food processor, process half at a time.)
Stir in sugar, walnuts, and orange peel. Cover and store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks or freeze up to 6 months.
Serve with ham or poultry. Makes 3 3/4 cups (fifteen 1/4-cup servings).

recipes.title: Salsa
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Boost the flavor of omelets or scrambled eggs by spooning this spicy sauce over them.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine tomato; tomato sauce; chili peppers; green onion; green pepper; cilantro or parsley; lemon juice; garlic; hot pepper sauce, if desired; and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Place about half of the tomato mixture in a blender container or food processor bowl. Cover and blend or process till smooth. Stir in remaining tomato mixture.

Cover and chill at least 4 hours before serving, stirring occasionally. Store in refrigerator up to 1 week. Use as a dip for tortilla chips or spoon over main dishes or vegetables. Makes about 2 cups (thirty-two 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Salsa Verde: Prepare as above, except omit tomato and tomato sauce. Add 6 to 8 fresh tomatillos, finely chopped, or one 13-ounce can tomatillos, rinsed, drained, and finely chopped, to chili pepper mixture. Makes about 1 3/4 cups.

recipes.title: Papaya-Apple Chutney
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Chutneys are often served as a condiment with highly spiced dishes.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine apples, papaya, brown sugar, green pepper, vinegar, raisins, water, onion, lime or lemon juice, salt, and garlic.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool. Cover and store in the refrigerator up to 4 weeks. Or freeze up to 12 months.
Before serving, if desired, stir in almonds. Serve with beef, ham, lamb, pork, or poultry. Makes about 2 1/4 cups (thirty-six 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Pineapple-Date Chutney: Prepare as above, except omit apples, papaya, and raisins. Combine 1/2 of a medium pineapple, peeled, cored, and chopped (about 2 cups), or one 20-ounce can pineapple chunks, drained, 3/4 cup pitted whole dates, snipped, and 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon with vinegar mixture.

recipes.title: Cucumber Relish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh cucumber relish for frankfurters or hamburgers.

instructions.text: Slice cucumber in half lengthwise; scoop out seeds and discard. Using a food processor or food grinder with a coarse blade, process or grind cucumber and onion (or finely chop by hand).
Drain. Stir in vinegar, sugar, oil, dillweed or mint, salt, and hot pepper sauce. Chill at least 8 hours before serving.
Cover; store in the refrigerator up to 1 week. Serve with frankfurters or hamburgers. Makes 1 1/4 cups (ten 2-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Catsup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The tomato flavor comes through in this homemade ketchup

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine vinegar, stick cinnamon, cloves, and celery seed; bring to boiling. Remove from heat.
Wash, core, and quarter tomatoes. Drain in a colander; discard liquid. Place tomatoes in an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven. Add onion. Bring to boiling. Cook 15 minutes, stirring often.
Rinse through a food mill or sieve; discard seeds. Return puree to kettle; add sugar, salt, and ground red pepper. Bring to boiling.
Strain vinegar mixture into tomato mixture; stir. Simmer for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or till reduced by half, stirring occasionally.
Ladle catsup into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes.
May refrigerate up to 1 month. Makes 4 half-pints.

recipes.title: Dill Pickles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic homemade dill pickles

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash cucumbers. Rinse well.
Cut off a slice from stem end of cucumbers. Pack cucumbers into hot, sterilized jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
Combine water, vinegar, and pickling salt. Bring to boiling.
Pour hot liquid over cucumbers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Add dill and mustard seed. Adjust lids.
Process in a boiling-water canner.

notes: Kosher-Style Dill Pickles: Prepare as above, substitute 2 cloves garlic, halved, for each jar (12 servings)

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Bread 'n' Butter Pickles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sweet and tangy sliced pickles

instructions.text: In a large bowl combine cucumbers, onions, salt, and cracked ice.
Let stand 3 hours. Stir in a large amount of cracked ice. Remove garlic.
In a large kettle, combine sugar, vinegar, turmeric, mustard seed, and celery seed. Add drained mixture.
Bring to boiling. Pack cucumber mixture, with liquid, into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace.
Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Corn Relish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh corn relish for canning

instructions.text: Cut corn from cobs (do not scrape cobs). Measure 6 cups corn.
In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine corn and 2 cups water.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 12 minutes or till nearly tender.
Add celery, red pepper, and green pepper, and onion. Stir in 2 cups vinegar, sugar, pickling salt, and celery seed. Return to boiling.
Boil, uncovered, 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir together remaining vinegar, flour, dry mustard, and turmeric.
Add to corn mixture. Cook and stir till bubbly; cook 1 minute more.
Ladle into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Vegetable Relish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Mixed vegetable relish for burgers and hot dogs

instructions.text: Using coarse blade of a food grinder, grind tomatoes, zucchini, peppers, onions, and garlic.
Place ground vegetable mixture in a colander. Let stand overnight. Drain well with plastic wrap. Place in a container.
Add salt. Bring to boiling, stirring often. Reduce heat. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat. Return mixture to ground vegetable mixture to boiling, stirring often. Stir in sugar, vinegar, water, thyme, and pepper. Bring to boiling.
Boiling-Water Canning: Ladle hot vegetables into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes.
Freezing: Cool vegetable mixture quickly by setting kettle into a sink of ice water. Ladle relish into freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Fruit-Juice Jelly
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Easy jelly made from unsweetened fruit juice

ingredients.item: unsweetened apple, grape, or cranberry juice or low-calorie cranberry juice cocktail

instructions.text: Pour fruit juice into a large kettle. (If using fresh apple juice, strain it through cheesecloth first.) Add 1/4 cup lemon juice and powdered pectin.
Bring to full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Stir in sugar. Return to full rolling boil; boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; quickly skim off foam with metal spoon.
Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.

recipes.title: Peach Jam
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic homemade peach jam

instructions.text: Peel, pit, and coarsely grind or mash peaches. Measure 4 cups.
In an 8- or 10-quart kettle combine peaches, pectin, and lemon juice. Stir in sugar.
Bring to full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Stir in sugar.
Return to full rolling boil; boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; quickly skim off foam with a metal spoon. Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.
Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.

notes: Peach-Plum Jam: Prepare as above, except add 1 pound fully ripe Italian prune plums, pitted and finely chopped (2 cups ground).
Peach-Berry Jam: Prepare as above except reduce peaches to 2 pounds (3 cups ground).
Add 2 cups strawberries, blackberries, or raspberries.

recipes.title: Grape Jam
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Homemade Concord grape jam

instructions.text: Wash and stem grapes. Measure 10 cups. Remove skins from half of the grapes by squeezing each grape between fingers.
In a large kettle cook skinned grapes, covered, about 10 minutes or till very soft. Strain into a bowl, pressing to extract juice. Discard seeds.
Add unskinned grapes and their skins to cooked pulp. Cook and stir over low heat about 10 minutes or till skins are tender.
Stir in sugar. Bring to full rolling boil, stirring often. Boil hard, uncovered, for 10 to 12 minutes or till mixture sheets off a metal spoon or jam reaches 220°F.
Remove from heat; quickly skim off foam. Ladle hot jam at once into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.
Process in a boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.

recipes.title: Orange Marmalade
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic citrus marmalade

instructions.text: Score orange and lemon peels into 4 lengthwise sections. Remove peels. Scrape off white portions from peels; discard.
Cut peels into very thin strips. Bring to boiling. Combine peels, water, and baking soda. Bring to boiling.
Cover; simmer for 20 minutes. Do not drain. Section fruits. Add fruit and juices to peel mixture. Return to boiling.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Measure 3 cups fruit mixture. Return to kettle or combine 3 cups fruit and sugar in an 8- or 10-quart kettle.
Bring to full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Add pectin. Return to full rolling boil; boil hard 1 minute. Remove from heat; skim off foam.
Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. (May take 2 weeks to set.)
Process in boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. Adjust lids.

missing_inputs: Not in database: liquid fruit pectin

recipes.title: Rhubarb-Raspberry Jam
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tangy-sweet rhubarb and raspberry combination

ingredients.item: frozen loose-pack raspberries or one 12-ounce package frozen raspberries

instructions.text: In a large Dutch oven combine rhubarb and sugar. Let stand 20 minutes.
Bring to boiling, stirring frequently. Boil hard for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add raspberries. Return to full rolling boil; boil 5 to 6 minutes or till thick, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Add gelatin; stir till dissolved.
Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars or freezer containers, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Seal, label. Let stand at room temperature about 2 hours or till jam is set.
Store up to 3 weeks in the refrigerator or 1 year in the freezer.

recipes.title: Berry Freezer Jam
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Quick no-cook freezer jam with fresh berries

ingredients.item: shredded lemon peel or orange peel

instructions.text: Crush berries. Measure 2 cups blackberries, raspberries, or strawberries.
In a bowl combine berries, sugar, and lemon peel or orange peel. Let stand 10 minutes.
Combine pectin and lemon juice. Add to berry mixture, stirring for 3 minutes.
Ladle at once into jars or freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Let stand at room temperature about 2 hours or till jam is set.
Store up to 3 weeks in the refrigerator or 1 year in the freezer.

missing_inputs: Not in database: liquid fruit pectin

recipes.title: Harvest Applesauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Homemade applesauce with cinnamon

instructions.text: In a large kettle combine apples, water, and, if desired, stick cinnamon.
Bring to boiling. Reduce heat; simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or till apples are very tender.
Remove stick cinnamon, if using. Mash apples with a food mill or press through a sieve.
Return pulp to kettle. Stir in sugar. (If desired, add 1/2 cup butter, stirring till melted.) Bring to boiling.
Boiling-Water Canning: Spoon hot applesauce into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.
Freezing: Cool applesauce. Spoon into freezer containers, leaving the recommended headspace (see tip, page 193). Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Apple Butter
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spiced apple butter spread

instructions.text: In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine apples and cider or juice.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 30 minutes or till very tender, stirring occasionally.
Press through a food mill or sieve. Return pulp to kettle (you should have about 15 cups).
Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and allspice. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for about 2 hours or till very thick, stirring often.
Boiling-Water Canning: Spoon hot apple butter into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.
Freezing: Cool apple butter. Place kettle in a sink of ice water to cool apple butter quickly, leaving the recommended headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Catsup
recipes.description: The fresh tomato flavor comes through in this classic condiment.

instructions.text: Wash, core, and quarter tomatoes. Drain in a colander; discard liquid. Place tomatoes in an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven. Add onions in an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven. Bring to boiling; cook 15 minutes, stirring often.

(Measure about 7 cups.) Return puree to kettle; add sugar. Bring to boiling. Clip candy thermometer to pan. Cook and stir to 220° (about 30 minutes or to desired consistency). Strain vinegar mixture into tomatoes; discard spices. Add salt. Simmer about 30 minutes more or till of desired consistency, stirring often.
May refrigerate up to 1 month. Makes 4 half-pints.

Boiling-Water Canning Directions: Ladle hot catsup into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes (start timing when water returns to boiling).

recipes.title: Dill Pickles

ingredients.item: fresh dill heads or dried dillseed

instructions.text: Thoroughly rinse cucumbers. Remove stems and cut off a thin slice from blossom end. Cut into spears or slice. Pack into hot, sterilized pint jars. In a saucepan combine water, vinegar, and salt. Bring to boiling.
Pour hot liquid over cucumbers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. Makes about 8 pints.

notes: Kosher-Style Dill Pickles: Prepare as above except substitute 2 cloves garlic, halved, for 1/2 teaspoon mustard seed or 2 to 3 tablespoons.

recipes.title: Bread 'n' Butter Pickles

instructions.text: In a large bowl combine cucumbers, onions, salt, and large kettle. Stir in a thin well. Remove garlic. In a large kettle combine vinegar, sugar, and dried mixture and celery seed. Add drained mix. Bring to boiling, stirring occasionally. Pack into hot sterilized pint jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process 10 minutes. Makes 8 pints (80 servings).

notes: Horseradish Pickles: Prepare as above, except add 1/2 cup prepared horseradish to the sugar mixture.

ingredients.item: medium head cauliflower, broken into flowerets

instructions.text: Cut cucumbers into 3/4-inch chunks or 1/2-inch slices. Pack cucumbers or other vegetables into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Mix pickling salt and water and bring to a boil. Ladle hot brine over cucumbers, remaining in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. Makes 5 pints (50 servings).

Cut corn from cobs (do not scrape cobs). Measure 4 cups. In an 8- or 10-quart Dutch oven combine corn and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 12 minutes or till nearly tender.

Add celery, red and green peppers, and onion. Stir in 2 cups vinegar, sugar, pickling salt, and celery seed. Return to boiling. Stir together remaining vinegar, flour, dry mustard, and turmeric. Add to corn mixture. Cook and stir 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir together remaining corn and all flour mixture to boiling; stir occasionally. Ladle into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. Makes 7 pints (224 one-tablespoon servings).

ingredients.item: medium firm ripe tomatoes, peeled, cored
large sweet red peppers, seeded, stems and seeds removed, cut up

instructions.text: Using coarse blade of a food grinder, grind tomatoes. Drain in a colander to drain in a large bowl. Place ground vegetables mixture in a clean, large bowl. Sprinkle with salt. Let stand overnight. Drain well.

Rinse well. Let stand overnight. Drain well. In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine sugar, water, thyme, and pepper. Bring to boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar. Stir in ground vegetable mixture. Return mixture to boiling. Remove from heat. Makes about 8 pints.

ingredients.item: unsweetened apple, grape, or cranberry juice cocktail, or low-calorie cranberry juice

instructions.text: Pour fruit juice into a 6- to 8-quart kettle. Bring to full rolling boil; stir in pectin. Add sugar. Return to full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Quickly skim off foam with a metal spoon. Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process 5 minutes. Makes 6 half-pints.

recipes.title: Peach Jam

instructions.text: Peel, pit, and coarsely grind or mash peaches. Measure 4 cups. In an 8- or 10-quart kettle combine peaches, pectin, and lemon juice. Stir in sugar. Bring to a full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Quickly skim off foam with a metal spoon. Ladle into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process 5 minutes. Makes 7 half-pints.

notes: Peach-Plum Jam: Prepare as above, except reduce peaches to 1 1/2 pounds (2 cups ground). Add 1 pound fully ripe Italian prune plums, pitted and finely chopped (2 cups), with pectin.
Peach-Berry Jam: Prepare as above, except add 2 cups strawberries, blackberries, or raspberries, crushed (1 cup), with pectin.

instructions.text: Score orange and lemon peel into 4 lengthwise sections. Remove peels; discard from fruits. Scrape off white portions of white pith from peel. Combine peel strips. Bring to boiling; Reduce heat. Cover and cook 20 minutes. Do not drain.

Remove membranes from fruits. Section fruits and chop; combine 3 cups juice and simmer for 10 minutes. Return to boiling. Measure 3 cups mixture and sugar. Bring to a full rolling boil. Quickly stir in pectin. Return to a full boil; stir, uncovered, 1 minute. Remove from heat. Skim off foam. Ladle at once into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. (May take 2 weeks to set.) Makes about 6 half-pints (96 one-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Grape Jam
recipes.description: One gallon of grapes should make about 10 cups.

instructions.text: Wash and stem grapes. Measure 10 cups. Remove skins from half of the grapes by squeezing the skinned grapes. Combine the skinned grapes and remaining grapes. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes and stir about 10 minutes or until very soft. Sieve about 2 cups water and cooked grapes. Return to kettle.

Stir in sugar. Bring to a full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil and stir for 12 minutes or till jam sheets off a metal spoon. Remove from heat. Quickly skim off foam. Ladle jam at once into hot, sterilized half-pint jars, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 5 minutes. Makes 6 half-pints (96 one-tablespoon servings).

In a large Dutch oven combine rhubarb and raspberries. Bring to boiling. Let stand for 20 minutes or till sugar is dissolved, stirring frequently. Boil hard for 10 minutes. Let stand 20 minutes. Bring to boiling; boil, uncovered, for 5 to 6 minutes or till thick, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Add gelatin; stir till dissolved. Ladle into hot half-pint jars or freezer containers, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze or 1 year in the freezer. Makes about 5 half-pints.

ingredients.item: blackberries, raspberries, or strawberries, caps removed

instructions.text: Crush berries. Measure 2 cups blackberries or raspberries, 1 3/4 cups strawberries. In a bowl combine berries, sugar, and lemon peel. Let stand 10 minutes.

Combine pectin and lemon juice. Add to berry mixture; stir for 3 minutes. Ladle at once into jars or freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Seal. Let stand at room temperature about 2 hours or till jam is set. Store up to 3 weeks in the refrigerator or 1 year in the freezer. Makes 4 half-pints (sixty-four 1-tablespoon servings).

In an 8- or 10-quart kettle combine apples, water, and, if desired, cinnamon. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Press through a food mill or sieve (you should have about 13 cups pulp).
Return pulp to kettle. Stir in sugar, cinnamon. Simmer, uncovered, about 2 hours or till very thick, stirring often. Makes about 8 half-pints (128 one-tablespoon servings).
Boiling-Water Canning: Spoon hot apple butter into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes.

Freezing: Spoon hot apple butter into a sink of ice water to cool apple butter. Place kettle in a sink of ice water to cool apple butter. Spoon into freezer containers, leaving the recommended headspace (see tip, page 193). Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Apple Butter
recipes.description: Freeze or can this spicy spread.

instructions.text: In an 8- or 10-quart kettle combine apples and cider. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Press through a food mill or sieve (you should have about 13 cups pulp).

Return pulp to kettle. Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and allspice. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or till very thick, stirring often. Spoon into hot, sterilized jars or freezer containers for quart or pint jars, leaving a 1/4-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in boiling-water canner for 5 minutes. (For pints, process for 5 minutes.) Makes 5 half-pints (see tip, page 193). Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Tomato Juice Cocktail
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Start with the smaller amount of horseradish and add more until you get just the zest you like.

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash tomatoes. Remove stems. Cut tomatoes into pieces. In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine cut tomatoes, celery, and onion. Bring to boiling; cook 15 minutes, stirring often.

Press tomato mixture through a food mill or sieve to extract juice; measure 12 cups juice. Discard solids. Return juice to kettle; add lemon juice, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, prepared horseradish, salt, and bottled hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling.
Pour hot juice into hot, clean pint jars, leaving ½-inch headspace. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 35 minutes (start timing when water returns to boil).

notes: Pressure Canning: Pour hot juice into hot, clean pint jars, leaving ½-inch headspace. Process for 15 minutes at 10 pounds pressure.
Freezing: Cool juice for 15 minutes. Pour into wide-top freezer containers, leaving a ½-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Tomato Juice
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Home-canned tomato juice with optional freezing instructions

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash 8 pounds ripe but firm tomatoes. Remove stems. Core and cut into pieces; drain.
Place tomatoes in an 8- or 10-quart kettle. Bring to boiling over low heat, stirring frequently. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till soft; stir often to prevent sticking.
Press tomatoes through a food mill or sieve. Discard solids. Return tomato juice to the kettle and bring to boiling.
Boil gently, uncovered, for 5 minutes, stirring often. Discard solids.
Pour hot juice into hot, clean pint jar or 2 tablespoons lemon juice to each quart jar. Pour hot juice into jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace.
Process pints for 35 minutes, quarts for 40 minutes in a boiling-water canner.

notes: Boiling-Water Canning: Add 1 tablespoon lemon juice to each hot, clean pint jar or 2 tablespoons lemon juice to each quart jar. If desired, add 1/4 teaspoon salt to each pint or 1/2 teaspoon salt to each quart jar.
Freezing: Cool tomato juice. Pour into wide-top freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

recipes.title: Mustard Pickles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tangy mustard-flavored cucumber pickles

instructions.text: Cut cucumbers into 6-inch chunks or 1/4-inch. Pack cucumbers, pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace.

Add celery seed. Return to boiling. Stir together remaining vinegar, mustard and turmeric. Add to corn mixture. Ladle into hot, sterilized jars. Adjust lids. Process in a boiling-water canner for 15 minutes. Makes 7 pints (22 one-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Peanut Sauce
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Pat Groen
recipes.description: Indonesian-style peanut sauce perfect for satay, grilled meats, and rice.

ingredients.prep_note: use less if using regular soy sauce

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir over gentle heat until mixed.
Heat only until hot, letting the sauce boil will cause the oil in the peanut butter to separate. A little more water may be added for desired consistency.
Serve over Saté, grilled meats, and or rice.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for hot pepper paste or Tabasco (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Strawberry Butter
recipes.description: Sweet strawberry butter for bread and muffins.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.

flags: Instructions incomplete - recipe continued on next page

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Fruit Sauce
recipes.description: Sweeten to taste with 1 to 2 tablespoons sugar. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

ingredients.prep_note: apricot halves, cherries, fruit cocktail, peach slices, pear slices, pineapple, raspberries, strawberries

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix orange peel, orange juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit.
Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 4-cup measure mix orange peel and juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till bubbly; stir every minute till slightly thickened, then every 30 seconds. Cook 30 seconds more.

missing_inputs: Not in database: canned or frozen fruit

recipes.title: Orange Sauce
recipes.description: Tastes great with gingerbread or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine or butter. Serve warm.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure mix sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 to 3 minutes or till bubbly; stir once. Stir in margarine. Serve warm.
Lemon Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute lemon peel for the orange peel and 1/2 cup water plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice for the orange juice. Makes 2/3 cup (4 servings).

recipes.title: Caramel Sauce
recipes.description: Rich caramel sauce for ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Stir in cream and corn syrup.
Cook and stir till bubbly (mixture may appear curdled). Cook and stir for 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat; stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve warm or cool over ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water, then cream and corn syrup. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 to 3 minutes or till bubbly, stirring every minute till slightly thickened, then every 30 seconds. Stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve as above.

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: Rich chocolate sauce for ice cream. To reheat 1/2 cup in your microwave oven, allow 15 to 30 seconds on high power.

instructions.text: In a heavy small saucepan melt chocolate pieces and margarine or butter. Add the sugar; gradually stir in milk.
Bring to boiling, reduce heat. Boil gently over low heat for 8 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Serve warm over ice cream.

notes: Peanut-Butter Fudge Sauce: Prepare as above, except, after cooking 8 minutes, stir in 1/4 cup peanut butter. Then remove from heat.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Sauce
recipes.description: Sweet-tart rhubarb sauce for cake or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix sugar, water, and, if desired, orange peel strip. Bring to boiling.
Add rhubarb slices. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes or till rhubarb is tender.
Remove peel. Serve over cake or ice cream.

recipes.title: Vanilla Sauce
recipes.description: Delicious with fresh or poached fruit.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine yolks, milk, and sugar. Cook and stir till mixture is thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Cool, then chill.
To serve, whip cream and vanilla to soft peaks. Fold into yolk mixture.

recipes.title: Whiskey Sauce
recipes.description: Southerners traditionally ladle this sauce over bread pudding.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in sugar, egg yolk, and water.
Cook and stir constantly over medium-low heat for 5 to 6 minutes or till sugar dissolves and mixture boils.
Remove from heat and stir in bourbon. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Hard Sauce
recipes.description: Traditionally served with steamed puddings and warm gingerbread.

instructions.text: In a small mixer bowl beat together softened margarine or butter and powdered sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed for 3 to 5 minutes or till mixture is well combined.
Beat in vanilla. Spoon into serving bowl. Chill to harden.
Serve with plum pudding or warm gingerbread.

notes: Brandy Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon brandy or rum for the vanilla.
Orange Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel and 1 tablespoon orange juice or orange liqueur for the vanilla.

recipes.title: Herbed Sauce for Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 167
recipes.description: A quick herbed butter sauce to brush over fish during baking or broiling.

ingredients.item: dried dillweed, basil, rosemary, or oregano

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter.
Stir in lemon juice, dried herb of choice (crushed), and pepper.
Brush over fish during baking or broiling (see fish cooking chart, page 185).

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
Choose your herb based on the fish: dillweed pairs well with salmon, basil with white fish, rosemary with heartier fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 167)

recipes.title: Fast Fish Fix-Ups (Quick Sauces)
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Three quick sauces to dress up baked fish fillets, fish portions, or fish sticks.

ingredients.item: Note: Choose one of the three sauce recipes below

instructions.text: DILLY-BUTTER SAUCE: Melt 1/4 cup margarine or butter in a saucepan. Stir in 1 tablespoon flour and 1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed. Add 3/4 cup milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in one 2-1/2 oz jar shredded process Swiss cheese. Makes 1 cup.
TEX-MEX SAUCE: Cook one 8-oz can tomato sauce, one 4-oz can diced green chili peppers, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, a pinch of sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon bottled hot pepper sauce till heated through.
SWEET-SOUR SAUCE: Cook one 10-oz can pineapple tidbits, one 8-oz jar sweet-sour sauce, and half of a green or sweet red pepper (cut into strips) till heated through.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
For a delicious dinner in a hurry, put frozen breaded fish portions or fish sticks in the oven and top with one of these easy sauces

recipes.title: Peanut Sauce
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Pat Groen

ingredients.item: garlic powder or grated garlic toes

ingredients.prep_note: use less if using soy sauce

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir over gentle heat until mixed. Heat only until hot, letting the sauce boil will cause the oil in the peanut butter to separate. A little more water may be added for desired consistency. Serve over Sate, grilled meats, and or rice.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for hot pepper paste or Tabasco (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Pesto for Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 269
recipes.description: Fresh basil pesto sauce perfect for tossing with hot pasta.

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine basil, Parmesan or Romano cheese, nuts, oil, and garlic. Cover and blend or process till the mixture is nearly smooth, stopping machine occasionally to scrape down sides.

Divide pesto into 4 portions. Serve 1 portion at a time over 4 ounces hot cooked pasta. (For remaining pesto, place each portion in an airtight container and chill for 1 to 2 days. Or, freeze for up to 1 month.)

notes: Spinach Pesto for Pasta: Prepare as above, except use 1/2 cup torn fresh spinach and 1/2 cup firmly packed fresh basil leaves instead of 1 cup basil.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 269)

recipes.title: Cream Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The perfect crowning touch for fried poultry.

instructions.text: After frying poultry, transfer poultry to a platter; keep warm. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the drippings in the skillet (discard remaining drippings).

Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. If necessary, thin with a little additional milk. Makes 1 3/4 cups (6 or 7 servings).

recipes.title: Pan Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast poultry drippings.

instructions.text: After transferring roast poultry to a serving platter, pour pan drippings into a large measuring cup. Also scrape the browned bits into the cup.

Skim and reserve fat from drippings. Place 1/4 cup of the fat in a medium saucepan (discard remaining fat). Stir in flour. Add enough broth or water to remaining drippings in the measuring cup to equal 2 cups. Add all at once to flour mixture.
Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 2 cups (8 to 10 servings).

recipes.title: Giblet Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Rich gravy with chopped giblets for extra flavor.

ingredients.item: turkey or chicken giblets and neck
pan drippings from roast turkey or chicken

instructions.text: Rinse giblets and neck. Refrigerate liver till needed. In a medium saucepan combine remaining giblets, neck, celery, onion, and lightly salted water to cover. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 1 hour or till tender. Add liver; simmer 20 to 30 minutes more for turkey (5 to 10 minutes more for chicken) or till tender.
Remove and finely chop giblets. Discard neck bones. Strain broth. Discard vegetables. Chill chopped giblets and broth till needed.
After transferring roast turkey or chicken to a platter, pour pan drippings into a large measuring cup. Skim and reserve fat from pan drippings.

Pour 1/4 cup of the fat into the saucepan (discard remaining fat). Stir in flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add reserved broth to the drippings to measure 1 1/2 cups. Add broth mixture all at once to flour mixture. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir in giblets. If desired, chop egg and stir in. Heat through. Makes 2 cups (8 to 10 servings).

recipes.title: White Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Basic white sauce - the foundation for many variations.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once.
Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Microwave directions available
Variations: Low-Calorie, Almond, Cheese, Curry, Herb-Garlic, Lemon-Chive, Mexicali, Parmesan, Sherry

recipes.title: Hollandaise Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A classic creamy sauce with a rich lemon flavor.

instructions.text: Cut margarine or butter into thirds and bring it to room temperature.

In the top of a double boiler combine egg yolks, water, lemon juice, pepper, and dash salt. Add one piece of the margarine or butter. Place over boiling water (upper pan should not touch water). Cook, stirring rapidly, till margarine melts and sauce begins to thicken.

Add the remaining margarine or butter, a piece at a time, stirring constantly. Cook and stir till sauce thickens (1 to 2 minutes). Immediately remove from heat. If sauce is too thick or curdles, immediately beat in 1 to 2 tablespoons hot tap water.
Serve the sauce with cooked vegetables, poultry, fish, or eggs. Makes about 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Béarnaise Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic French sauce with tarragon - perfect for steak.

ingredients.item: snipped fresh tarragon or 1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed
snipped fresh chervil or pinch dried chervil, crushed

instructions.text: Cut margarine into thirds and bring it to room temperature. In a small saucepan combine vinegar, onion, tarragon, chervil, and pepper. Bring to boiling; boil 2 minutes on high or till reduced by about half.

In the top of a double boiler combine yolks, 1 tablespoon water, and vinegar mixture. Add one piece of the margarine. Place over boiling water (upper pan should not touch water). Cook, stirring rapidly, till margarine melts and sauce begins to thicken.

Add remaining margarine, a piece at a time, stirring constantly. Cook and stir till thickened (1 to 2 minutes). Immediately remove from heat. If sauce is too thick or curdles, immediately beat in 1 to 2 tablespoons hot tap water.
Serve with beef, pork, or poultry. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Sweet-Sour Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Perfect for spareribs, egg rolls, or fried wontons.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir in vinegar, pineapple juice, green pepper, pimiento, soy sauce, garlic powder, and ginger.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Serve warm with spareribs, egg rolls, or fried wontons. Makes about 1 1/4 cups (twenty 1-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Basic Barbecue Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Vary the hotness by adjusting the amount of hot pepper sauce.

ingredients.item: finely chopped onion or 1 tablespoon dried minced onion

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine catsup, onion, vinegar, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, celery seed, hot pepper sauce, 1/2 cup water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or to desired consistency.
Brush on beef, pork, or poultry during the last 10 to 20 minutes of grilling or roasting. If desired, pass remaining sauce. Makes 1 1/2 cups (twenty-eight 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Hot-Style Barbecue Sauce: Add 1 teaspoon chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon ground red pepper with the catsup
Tangy Mustard Barbecue Sauce: Omit celery seed. Add 2 tablespoons prepared mustard and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder with the catsup

recipes.title: Tartar Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic accompaniment for fish and seafood.

ingredients.item: finely chopped sweet or dill pickle or dill pickle relish

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, pickle, onion, parsley, pimiento, and lemon juice.
Cover and chill at least 2 hours before serving. Store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks.
Serve with fish or seafood. Makes 1 1/4 cups (twenty 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: EASY recipe tag
Low-Fat Tartar Sauce: Substitute 1/3 cup reduced-calorie mayonnaise or salad dressing and 2/3 cup plain yogurt for the mayonnaise. Omit lemon juice.

recipes.title: Cranberry Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh homemade cranberry sauce for the holidays.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar. Boil rapidly for 5 minutes.
Add cranberries. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Boil gently over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes or till skins pop, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Serve warm or chilled with beef, pork, or poultry. Makes about 2 cups (eight 1/4-cup servings).

notes: Molded Cranberry Sauce: Cook cranberry mixture for 13 to 16 minutes or till a drop gels on a cold plate. Pour into a 1 1/2-cup mold; chill till firm. Unmold.

Almond Cranberry Sauce: Substitute 1/3 cup honey for the sugar. Boil 8 minutes before adding cranberries. After removing from heat, stir in 1/4 cup apricot or peach preserves or orange marmalade and 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds.

recipes.title: Plum Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Asian-inspired sauce for beef, lamb, pork, or poultry.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine red plum jam, sliced green onion, and cornstarch. Add dry sherry, soy sauce, and vinegar.
Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Serve with beef, lamb, pork, or poultry. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Steak and Burger Toppings
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Dress up steaks and burgers with one of these sauces. Each makes enough for 4 servings.
notes: Mushroom-Onion Sauce: Cook 1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms and ¼ cup sliced green onion in 2 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in ½ cup dairy sour cream and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Heat through; do not boil.
Sour Cream and Chive Sauce: Combine ½ cup dairy sour cream, 2 tablespoons snipped chives, 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, and dash pepper. Chill.

Mustard-Chive Sauce: In a saucepan melt 1 tablespoon margarine or butter. Stir in 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour and ½ teaspoon salt till bubbly. Add ¾ cup milk. Cook and stir till bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tablespoon snipped chives and 1 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard.

Parsley Pesto: In a blender container place 2 cups lightly packed chopped parsley, 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts, 1 clove garlic, quartered. Cover and blend till nearly smooth. Stir in ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 242
recipes.description: Classic Italian-American meat sauce for spaghetti.

instructions.text: In Dutch oven cook meat, onion, green pepper, and celery till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, sugar, oregano, basil, bay leaf, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer about 30 minutes or till desired consistency. Discard bay leaf. Serve over hot pasta. Serves 6.

Microwave directions: In a 3-quart casserole combine meat, onion, green pepper, and garlic on 100% power (high) for 6 to 8 minutes or till no pink remains, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients except pasta. Micro-cook, covered, on high 6 to 8 minutes or till mixture bubbles, stirring once. Discard bay leaf. Serve over pasta. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Pan Gravy for Roasted Meat
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast drippings

instructions.text: After removing roasted meat from pan, pour drippings into a large measuring cup, scraping out the crusty browned bits. Skim fat. (To skim fat, tilt measuring cup and spoon off the oily liquid that rises to the top.) Reserve 1/4 cup fat.
In a medium saucepan combine reserved fat and 1/4 cup all-purpose flour. Add enough beef broth or water to drippings in the measuring cup to equal 2 cups liquid.
Add to flour mixture. Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more.
Season to taste.

recipes.title: Pan Gravy for Roasted Meat
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast meat drippings.

instructions.text: After removing roasted meat from pan, pour drippings into a large measuring cup, scraping out the crusty browned bits. Skim fat, reserving ¼ cup fat. (To skim fat: The oily liquid that rises to the top.)
Reserve all the oily liquid and ¼ cup of reserved fat.
In a medium saucepan combine reserved fat and ¼ cup all-purpose flour. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add enough beef broth or water to equal 2 cups liquid. Add all at once to flour mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more. Season to taste.

notes: The browned bits from the pan add tremendous flavor

recipes.title: Fruit Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sweeten to taste with 1 to 2 tablespoons sugar.

ingredients.item: 8- to 8 1/2-ounce can fruit (unpeeled apricot halves, pitted light sweet cherries, fruit cocktail, peach slices, pear slices, or crushed pineapple) or one 10-ounce package frozen fruit, thawed (red raspberries, strawberries, or peach slices)

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix orange peel, orange juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

notes: Lemon Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute lemon peel for the orange peel and 1/2 cup water plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice for the orange juice. Makes 2/3 cup (4 servings).

recipes.title: Caramel Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Stir in cream and corn syrup. Cook and stir till bubbly (mixture may appear curdled). Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve warm or cool over ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

recipes.title: Orange Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tastes great with gingerbread or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine or butter. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix sugar, water, and, if desired, 1 strip orange peel. Bring to boiling. Add rhubarb slices. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes or till rhubarb is tender. Remove peel. Serve over cake or ice cream.

recipes.title: Vanilla Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Delicious with fresh or poached fruit.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine yolks, milk, and sugar. Cook and stir till mixture is thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Cool, then chill. To serve, whip cream and vanilla to soft peaks. Fold into yolk mixture.

recipes.title: Whiskey Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southerners traditionally ladle this sauce over bread pudding.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in sugar, egg yolk, and water. Cook and stir constantly over medium-low heat for 5 to 6 minutes or till sugar dissolves and mixture boils. Remove from heat and stir in bourbon. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Whipped Cream
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a chilled bowl combine whipping cream, sugar, and vanilla. Beat with chilled beaters of an electric mixer on medium speed till soft peaks form. Serve with pie, fruit desserts, cake, cream puffs, and hot drinks.

notes: Flavored Whipped Cream: Prepare as above, except add one of the following with the vanilla: 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder plus 1 tablespoon additional sugar, 2 tablespoons amaretto or coffee, hazelnut, orange, or praline liqueur; 1 teaspoon instant coffee crystals; 1/2 teaspoon almond extract; 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded lemon, orange, or lime peel; or 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, nutmeg, or ginger.

recipes.title: Hard Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Traditionally served with steamed puddings and warm gingerbread.

instructions.text: In a small mixer bowl beat together softened margarine or butter and powdered sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed for 3 to 5 minutes or till mixture is well combined. Beat in vanilla. Spoon into serving bowl. Chill to harden. Serve with plum pudding or warm gingerbread.

notes: Brandy Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon brandy or rum for the vanilla.
Orange Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel and 1 tablespoon orange juice or orange liqueur for the vanilla.

recipes.title: Herbed Sauce for Fish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Here's an easy sauce to brush over fish during baking or broiling (see chart, page 185). In a small saucepan melt 3 tablespoons margarine or butter.

ingredients.item: dried dillweed or dried basil, rosemary, or oregano, crushed; and/or snipped parsley

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt 3 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed or dried basil, rosemary, or oregano, crushed, and/or 1 tablespoon snipped parsley, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Brush with margarine mixture. Grill for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.servings_yield: Makes about 1/4 cup (enough for 1 pound of fillets)
